description.narrative: Output 36: Additional 30 District Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) Departments and 500 gender responsive community WATSAN Committees/WSDBs are better able to facilitate delivery of sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 10: Enabling environment: Sector policies, strategies, knowledge base, systems and human resource capacity at national level and in 5 most deprived regions are improved for enabling decentralised, scaled-up, sustainable and pro-poor Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services by 2016

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 36: Additional 30 District WASH Departments and 500 gender responsive community WATSAN Committees/WSDBs are better able tofacilitate delivery of sustainable WASH services

description.narrative: UNICEF supported government to build decentralized financial and program management capacity to deliver equitable WASH programming in 38 districts, including incorporating sanitation strategies and targets into medium-term district plans. Gender mainstreaming and decentralized capacity building was demonstrated in 56 districts through community-based water management and community led total sanitation implementation. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/11/2017

title.narrative: Number of MMDAs implementing child-focused and gender sensitive WASH plans
